verses.kjv: And he made the altar of burnt offering of shittim wood: five cubits was the length thereof, and five cubits the breadth thereof; it was foursquare; and three cubits the height thereof.
verses.web: He made the altar of burnt offering of acacia wood. It was square. Its length was five cubits, its width was five cubits, and its height was three cubits.
verses.ct: Bezalel built the altar of burnt offering out of acacia wood. It was square — 5 cubits long, 5 cubits wide, and 3 cubits tall.

verses.kjv: And he made the horns thereof on the four corners of it; the horns thereof were of the same: and he overlaid it with brass.
verses.web: He made its horns on its four corners. Its horns were of one piece with it, and he overlaid it with bronze.
verses.ct: He crafted a horn at each of its 4 corners, forming them as one piece with the altar itself, and covered the whole thing in bronze.

verses.kjv: And he made all the vessels of the altar, the pots, and the shovels, and the basons, and the fleshhooks, and the firepans: all the vessels thereof made he of brass.
verses.web: He made all the vessels of the altar: the pots, the shovels, the basins, the forks, and the fire pans. He made all its vessels of bronze.
verses.ct: He made all the tools that went with the altar — the pots, shovels, basins, meat forks, and firepans. Every one of them was made of bronze.

verses.kjv: And he made for the altar a brasen grate of network under the compass thereof beneath unto the midst of it.
verses.web: He made for the altar a grating of a network of bronze, under the ledge around it beneath, reaching halfway up.
verses.ct: He also made a bronze grating with a mesh design and attached it below the altar's ledge, reaching halfway up the altar.

verses.kjv: And he cast four rings for the four ends of the grate of brass, to be places for the staves.
verses.web: He cast four rings for the four corners of bronze grating, to be places for the poles.
verses.ct: He cast 4 bronze rings and attached them to the 4 corners of the grating to hold the carrying poles.

verses.kjv: And he made the staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with brass.
verses.web: He made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with bronze.
verses.ct: He made the carrying poles from acacia wood and covered them with bronze.

verses.kjv: And he put the staves into the rings on the sides of the altar, to bear it withal; he made the altar hollow with boards.
verses.web: He put the poles into the rings on the sides of the altar, with which to carry it. He made it hollow with planks.
verses.ct: He slid the poles through the rings on the sides of the altar so it could be carried. The altar itself was hollow inside, built from planks.

verses.kjv: And he made the laver of brass, and the foot of it of brass, of the lookingglasses of the women assembling, which assembled at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
verses.web: He made the basin of bronze, and its base of bronze, out of the mirrors of the ministering women who ministered at the door of the Tent of Meeting.
verses.ct: He made the bronze basin and its bronze stand from the mirrors donated by the women who served at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.kjv: And he made the court: on the south side southward the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, an hundred cubits:
verses.web: He made the court: for the south side southward the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, one hundred cubits;
verses.ct: Then he built the courtyard. Along the south side, the curtain walls were made of finely woven linen and stretched 100 cubits long.

verses.kjv: Their pillars were twenty, and their brasen sockets twenty; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.
verses.web: their pillars were twenty, and their sockets twenty, of bronze; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.
verses.ct: These curtains hung from 20 pillars set in 20 bronze bases, with silver hooks and silver bands on the pillars.

verses.kjv: And for the north side the hangings were an hundred cubits, their pillars were twenty, and their sockets of brass twenty; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver.
verses.web: For the north side one hundred cubits, their pillars twenty, and their sockets twenty, of bronze; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver.
verses.ct: The north side was identical — 100 cubits of curtains hung from 20 pillars set in 20 bronze bases, with silver hooks and silver bands.

verses.kjv: And for the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten, and their sockets ten; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver.
verses.web: For the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten, and their sockets ten; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver.
verses.ct: The west side had curtains stretching 50 cubits, hung from 10 pillars set in 10 bases, with silver hooks and silver bands.

verses.kjv: And for the east side eastward fifty cubits.
verses.web: For the east side eastward fifty cubits,
verses.ct: The east side — the front of the courtyard — also measured 50 cubits across.

verses.kjv: The hangings of the one side of the gate were fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.
verses.web: the hangings for the one side were fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three;
verses.ct: On one side of the entrance, the curtains extended 15 cubits, supported by 3 pillars set in 3 bases.

verses.kjv: And for the other side of the court gate, on this hand and that hand, were hangings of fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.
verses.web: and so for the other side: on this hand and that hand by the gate of the court were hangings of fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.
verses.ct: The other side of the entrance was the same — 15 cubits of curtains supported by 3 pillars set in 3 bases.

verses.kjv: All the hangings of the court round about were of fine twined linen.
verses.web: All the hangings around the court were of fine twined linen.
verses.ct: Every curtain surrounding the courtyard was made of finely woven linen.

verses.kjv: And the sockets for the pillars were of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver; and the overlaying of their chapiters of silver; and all the pillars of the court were filleted with silver.
verses.web: The sockets for the pillars were of bronze. The hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver. Their capitals were overlaid with silver. All the pillars of the court had silver bands.
verses.ct: The bases for the pillars were bronze. The hooks and bands on the pillars were silver, and the tops of the pillars were overlaid with silver. Every pillar in the courtyard had silver bands.

verses.kjv: And the hanging for the gate of the court was needlework, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: and twenty cubits was the length, and the height in the breadth was five cubits, answerable to the hangings of the court.
verses.web: The screen for the gate of the court was the work of the embroiderer, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen. Twenty cubits was the length, and the height along the width was five cubits, like the hangings of the court.
verses.ct: The screen at the courtyard entrance was embroidered with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn woven into fine linen. It was 20 cubits long and 5 cubits high, matching the height of the courtyard curtains.

verses.kjv: And their pillars were four, and their sockets of brass four; their hooks of silver, and the overlaying of their chapiters and their fillets of silver.
verses.web: Their pillars were four, and their sockets four, of bronze; their hooks of silver, and the overlaying of their capitals, and their fillets, of silver.
verses.ct: This screen hung from 4 pillars set in 4 bronze bases. The hooks were silver, and the tops of the pillars were overlaid with silver, with silver bands around them.

verses.kjv: And all the pins of the tabernacle, and of the court round about, were of brass.
verses.web: All the pins of the tabernacle, and around the court, were of bronze.
verses.ct: All the tent pegs for the tabernacle and the surrounding courtyard were made of bronze.

verses.kjv: This is the sum of the tabernacle, even of the tabernacle of testimony, as it was counted, according to the commandment of Moses, for the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar, son to Aaron the priest.
verses.web: These are the amounts of materials used for the tabernacle, even the Tabernacle of the Testimony, as they were counted, according to the commandment of Moses, for the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.
verses.ct: Here is the inventory of materials used for the tabernacle — the Tabernacle of the Testimony — recorded at Moses' command by the Levites under the direction of Ithamar, son of Aaron the priest.

verses.kjv: And Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: Bezalel son of Uri, grandson of Hur, from the tribe of Judah, carried out everything the LORD had commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: And with him was Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver, and a cunning workman, and an embroiderer in blue, and in purple, and in scarlet, and fine linen.
verses.web: With him was Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver, and a skillful workman, and an embroiderer in blue, in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen.
verses.ct: Working alongside him was Aholiab son of Ahisamach, from the tribe of Dan, who was a skilled engraver, designer, and embroiderer in blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and fine linen.

verses.kjv: All the gold that was occupied for the work in all the work of the holy place, even the gold of the offering, was twenty and nine talents, and seven hundred and thirty shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary.
verses.web: All the gold that was used for the work in all the work of the sanctuary, even the gold of the offering, was twenty-nine talents and seven hundred thirty shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary.
verses.ct: The total gold used throughout the construction of the sanctuary — all of it donated as an offering — came to 29 talents and 730 shekels, measured by the sanctuary standard.

verses.kjv: And the silver of them that were numbered of the congregation was an hundred talents, and a thousand seven hundred and threescore and fifteen shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary:
verses.web: The silver of those who were counted of the congregation was one hundred talents and one thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary:
verses.ct: The silver collected from the census of the community totaled 100 talents and 1,775 shekels, measured by the sanctuary standard.

verses.kjv: A bekah for every man, that is, half a shekel, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for every one that went to be numbered, from twenty years old and upward, for six hundred thousand and three thousand and five hundred and fifty men.
verses.web: a beka a head, that is, half a shekel, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, for everyone who passed over to those who were counted, from twenty years old and upward, for six hundred three thousand five hundred fifty men.
verses.ct: This came from a tax of one beka — that is, half a shekel by the sanctuary standard — collected from every man 20 years old and older who was counted in the census. The total number of men was 603,550.

verses.kjv: And of the hundred talents of silver were cast the sockets of the sanctuary, and the sockets of the vail; an hundred sockets of the hundred talents, a talent for a socket.
verses.web: The one hundred talents of silver were for casting the sockets of the sanctuary and the sockets of the veil: one hundred sockets for the one hundred talents, one talent per socket.
verses.ct: The 100 talents of silver were used to cast the bases for the sanctuary frames and the bases for the posts supporting the veil — 100 bases from 100 talents, one talent per base.

verses.kjv: And of the thousand seven hundred seventy and five shekels he made hooks for the pillars, and overlaid their chapiters, and filleted them.
verses.web: From the one thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels he made hooks for the pillars, overlaid their capitals, and made fillets for them.
verses.ct: With the remaining 1,775 shekels, he made the hooks for the pillars, overlaid their tops with silver, and fashioned their silver bands.

verses.kjv: And the brass of the offering was seventy talents, and two thousand and four hundred shekels.
verses.web: The bronze of the offering was seventy talents and two thousand four hundred shekels.
verses.ct: The bronze donated as an offering totaled 70 talents and 2,400 shekels.

verses.kjv: And therewith he made the sockets to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and the brasen altar, and the brasen grate for it, and all the vessels of the altar,
verses.web: With this he made the sockets to the door of the Tent of Meeting, the bronze altar, the bronze grating for it, all the vessels of the altar,
verses.ct: With it he made the bases for the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, the bronze altar, its bronze grating, and all the altar's tools.

verses.kjv: And the sockets of the court round about, and the sockets of the court gate, and all the pins of the tabernacle, and all the pins of the court round about.
verses.web: the sockets around the court, the sockets of the gate of the court, all the pins of the tabernacle, and all the pins around the court.
verses.ct: He also made the bases for the courtyard pillars, the bases for the courtyard entrance, and all the tent pegs for both the tabernacle and the surrounding courtyard.
